 Air Products  PLC   
4 Sep 201 7 – Present  Process Safety Engineer - European Operations   
 Responsibilities and accountabilities    
 Lead  Process Hazard Reviews by trave lling onsite for large Air Separation Units (ASUs) and 
Packaged Gases Facilities  (cylinder loading plants)  throughout  Europe (Spain, France, Poland,  
Germany,  UK). Actively checked progress and ensured safety actions from the hazard reviews 
are implemented efficiently and on time.  
 Create d SIL Assessments using the LOPA methodology to ensure company safety target is 
met. S pecial focus on  overfill of  low pressure flat bottom storage tanks  (SIL 3 systems)  and 
road tanker  loading operations  (overpressure and los s of containment).  
 Produce d a Quantified  Bow Tie Assessment to comply with the French national regulator for 
a large Air Separation Unit. Answered all authority questions as required.  
 Evaluate d vent location by  simulating  discharge plumes  using PHAST DNV t o prevent 
asphyxiation and/or toxic exposure of personnel  to vented gases. This includes  heat radiation  
calculations  for jet fire releases  to ensure flammable vents are at safe heights.  
 Ensure d Packaged Gas Sites (cylinder loading plants with flammable gas es) are compliant 
with ATEX and DSEA R regulations . 
 Assist ed in interpretation of national/local Process Safety Regulatory  requirements for the 
region where the plant is located .  
 Provide d process safety consulting support and recommend ed optimal solutions to 
European wide Packaged Gas Facilities ensuring the management of change (MOC) system 
was adequately followed as well as  following the guidance documentation of the European 
    
  
 Industrial Gases Association (EIGA) . 
 Chaired of the Retrofit Committee ensuring changes to Engineering Standards are discussed 
to identify which ones become mandatory retrofit actions for existing plants.  
 Devel oped global process safety standards, tools, programs, training courses, and work 
process  throughout my role.  
 Ensure safety i s maintained at a 6 ton/day Liquid Hydrogen Plant  by completing SIL 
Assessments using the LOPA methodology for the Liquid Hydrogen Storage Sphere and the 
Liquid Hydrogen Road Tanker Loading Bay.  
 Ensured plants are supported by troubleshooting and indentify ing process safety problems. 
Ensured problems and incidents are reported and resolved.  
 
5 Sep 2016 - 4 Sep 2017  Process Systems Engineer - Global Engineering and Manufacturing   
 Responsibilities and accountabilities   
 Completed Site Work Instruction Manu als (operating manuals) for start -up, shutdown, 
emergency shutdown for large ASUs  
 Created change notes to modify P&IDs to meet customer requirements and internal 
Engineering S tandards  
 Lead the creation of a 50 ton/day Liquefier P&ID  
 Participated in HAZOPs ensuring actions are i mplemented in P&ID change notes  
 Created cause and effects diagrams for a 75,000 ton/day Oxygen and Nitrogen  ASU and for 
30,000 m3/day Helium plant  
1 Sep 2015 - 5 Sep 2016  Process Engineer - European Operations  
 Responsibilities and accountabilities    
 Provided technical support to maintain operation of ASUs in United Kingdom  
 Trouble -shooting plant process issues by analysing data and developing solutions  
 Supervised change out of  molecular sieves for Thermal Swing Adsorbers  
 Created cha nge n

Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
